image.altText: Outline of a stadium as seen from Hobart's cenotaph

props.synopsis: A panel assessing the proposed Macquarie Point stadium in Hobart believes the government has grossly underestimated the cost and overestimated the benefits to such an extent that it risks Tasmania's credit rating.

title.children: Planning Commission lashes Hobart stadium plan

image.altText: Man holding sign on green lawn

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese's law changes to guarantee the future of farmed salmon in Macquarie Harbour are facing counter moves, with the Bob Brown Foundation launching a legal challenge in the Federal Court.

title.children: Bob Brown Foundation launches legal challenge against PM's 'rushed' salmon bill

image.altText: The exterior of a Coles shopfront

props.synopsis: More than 20 pre-packaged salad products are being recalled by major supermarket retailers after Queensland's public health surveillance detected two products contaminated with a strain of E. coli.

title.children: Major supermarkets recall salad products due to contamination concerns

image.altText: A graphic with 15 faces with the words 'Your Say'

props.synopsis: With the federal election campaign underway, we've spoken to 15 Tasmanians from across the state's five electorates to see what topics they most want to see addressed.

title.children: Your Say: What matters to Tasmanian voters this federal election?

image.altText: Woman standing at podium delivering speech to crowd on Parliament lawns

props.synopsis: As the 30th anniversary looms for a debate that earned Tasmania a place in the world record books, three people who took part reflect on the marathon effort.

title.children: All-hours debate over 29 days snared Tasmania a world record in the 90s

image.altText: A young boy with a gold shirt and a mullet plays a silver horn instrument as an older gentleman helps him follow the score.

props.synopsis: This northern Tasmanian band will celebrate its 146th birthday but with the average player aged in their 70s, the band is looking to secure its future. It's teamed up with a local primary school, offering free tuition in the hope some of the students will gain the skills to join in.

title.children: This brass band is offering free tuition to bring in a new generation

image.altText: A woman with short hair smiles with a bull terrier resting its head on her lap in a living room with white shelving.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian state law has the weakest protections for people relying on assistance animals, and discrimination reports are growing. Those affected say considering legal action to access public spaces and necessary services is exhausting.

title.children: 'Incredibly outdated' assistance dog laws leaving people in limbo

image.altText: A Buddhist monk walks near a collapsed pagoda.

props.synopsis: After an earthquake in Myanmar, more than 1,700 people are dead, rescue crews are searching the rubble of a skyscraper in Bangkok, and aid is struggling to reach people in need of medical care, food and water.

title.children: An earthquake shook Bangkok's infinity pools. Here's what happened on the ground

image.altText: Jim Chalmers

props.synopsis: Both major parties know how to improve Australia’s abysmal productivity performance but they have deemed it too hard.

title.children: No party is providing real answers to Australia's two biggest issues

image.altText: Ben Roberts-Smith in a suit and tie

props.synopsis: The war veteran has been awaiting a decision in the appeal for more than a year, after the Federal Court previously found the publisher had proven, to the civil standard, allegations he was involved in four murders in Afghanistan and an allegation of bullying.

title.children: Ben Roberts-Smith seeking to reopen failed defamation case over recording

image.altText: A man wearing a polo shirt looks directly at the camera with a neutral expression. Behind him is a footpath, then a beach.

props.synopsis: An investigation spanning more than a decade finds Mark Standen protected criminals, sabotaged investigations, and is believed to have helped facilitate drug imports.

title.children: Corrupt cop breaks his silence as new evidence of his criminality emerges

image.altText: Q+A: Ageism in a cost of living crisis

props.synopsis: New polling commissioned by Q+A shows Australians are still struggling with bills and want leaders to focus on financial support during the election campaign.

title.children: 'Ignored again': Most Australians feeling financially worse off

image.altText: A person holds a pen and a stack of postal vote papers.

props.synopsis: Australia's electoral commissioner has urged voters to "carefully consider" who they give their personal information to as the election campaign gets underway.

title.children: Voters warned to be wary of unsolicited postal vote application texts

image.altText: An ariel from helicopter of building under water.

props.synopsis: Graziers say more aviation fuel is desperately needed as helicopters play a key role in evacuations, supply drops, and mustering.

title.children: Graziers brace for stock losses as floodwaters sweep through outback Queensland

image.altText: Two people in white forensic outfits covering their entire body observing the inside of a home. One is taking a photo inside.

props.synopsis: Police officers found a 47-year-old woman, a 16-year-old girl, a 13-year-old girl and a 10-year-old boy with stab wounds at the scene in Baulkham Hills after being contacted by the children's father.

title.children: Woman accused of stabbing her three children in their bedrooms

image.altText: Eight Race Around the World contestants posing for a group shot, blue background.

props.synopsis: The untold stories from behind the scenes of Race Around the World, the show that launched John Safran and became one of the 90s most unlikely hits.

title.children: 'We could have died': Inside the insanity of an unlikely 90s TV hit

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: The ASX 200 dropped 1.7 per cent, erasing $45 billion in value as fears for the global economy mount. See how the day unfolded on our live blog.

title.children: ASX sheds $45 billion as miners hammered — as it happened

image.altText: A close up photo of Prince Harry's face

props.synopsis: The Duke of Sussex has been accused of "harassment and bullying at scale" by the chair of a charity he founded.

title.children: Prince Harry's charity has been hit with 'damning' accusations. What happens next?

image.altText: A woman in a hospital bed holding a newborn baby

props.synopsis: Expectant mothers on the NSW Central Coast now have to travel to Sydney or Newcastle to birth in a private hospital after the region's only private maternity ward shut down.

title.children: Private maternity ward closure leaves expectant mums with fewer choices

image.altText: A woman sitting at a round dining table holds a photo of her late adult brother.

props.synopsis: Australia's corporate watchdog calls on superannuation funds to overhaul the way they deal with death insurance claims, noting excessive delays, poor customer service and ineffective claims handling.

title.children: ASIC's scathing review of super funds finds 'genuine suffering'

image.altText: Australian Electoral Commission staff in purple vests sit at a table counting votes as other people in green vests watch over.

props.synopsis: For many Australians, May 3 will be the first time they head to the polls. Here's how you enrol to vote.

title.children: How do I enrol to vote for this federal election? Your questions answered

image.altText: Anthony Albanese in Canberra

props.synopsis: Labor is distancing itself from original modelling that predicted a thwarted $275 cut to power prices, as the Coalition also keeps modelling on its gas plan at arm's length — refusing to put a dollar figure on its predicted price reduction.

title.children: Labor and Coalition coy on power prices, with modelling kept at arm's length

image.altText: Drone shot of a large green park surrounded by houses with the ocean in the background.

props.synopsis: A sovereign citizen who abducted her child in a hire van before she was intercepted by police en route to a supposed "sovereign state" is sentenced to two years' jail.

title.children: Sovereign citizen jailed after kidnapping her own child from park

image.altText: A yellow ant.

props.synopsis: Scientists say land managers in Queensland's Wet Tropics are winning the war against one of the world's worst invasive ant species but fear the gains could be lost if federal funding is allowed to run out.

title.children: One of Australia's most successful pest eradication programs hangs in balance

image.altText: A ginger cat stretches out on the ground in front of a temple, a tree with pink cherry blossoms behind it

props.synopsis: Japanese director Soda Kazuhiro has made documentaries about fishing villages and the impact of modernisation. This time he's focusing on a pack of entitled cats, and what they can tell us about the humans who live with them.

title.children: A Japanese shrine has been overtaken by cats — but it's not always cute

image.altText: Aerial shot of a mine and buildings

props.synopsis: Newmont Corporation, owner of the Cadia mine at Orange in New South Wales, is convicted of exceeding dust regulations on five occasions between 2021 and 2023.

title.children: One of the country's largest gold mines fined $350k for air pollution

image.altText: A portrait of Rob Halliday looking sombre, standing in front of a rocky shore.

props.synopsis: The level of violence faced by school leaders is the worst it's ever been, with both students and their parents reportedly making threats, according to a long-running survey of more than 2,000 principals.

title.children: 'Bitten' by students, 'cyberbullied' by parents: School leaders report record violence

image.altText: Richard Norton smiling at camera in a grey shirt, in front of a white hallway.

props.synopsis: The actor, martial artist, and choreographer worked on more than 80 films in his career.

title.children: Actor Richard Norton dies aged 75

image.altText: a man being wheeled by paramedics outside court

props.synopsis: A teenager who pleaded guilty to the stabbing murder of a 19-year-old man has been attacked in court by the victim's family on Monday.

title.children: Chaos breaks out in Brisbane courtroom during teen's sentencing

image.altText: German startup Isar Aerospace explodes after falling down in Norway

props.synopsis: German startup Isar Aerospace says this was an initial test as part of a project aimed at kickstarting satellite launches from Europe.

title.children: Space rocket explodes seconds after take-off but described as a 'success'

image.altText: red sherrin football to sitting on green grass with football goal posts and football club in the background

props.synopsis: Andrew Krakouer, who played 137 AFL games for Richmond and Collingwood, has died age 42.

title.children: 'He loved everyone': AFL world reacts to death of Andrew Krakouer, aged 42

image.altText: Protesters gather in front of the US consulate during a demonstration in Nuuk

props.synopsis: The Greenland prime minister says "President Trump says that the United States is getting Greenland. Let me be clear: The United States won't get that."

title.children: Trump says US will 'get Greenland', new prime minister says it won't

image.altText: Brian Mier, dressed in short-sleeved shirt, examines a large lump on his arm.

props.synopsis: Victoria's planned surgery waitlist has been growing again, with warnings many are still languishing in a "hidden" queue in the state's complex health system.

title.children: As Victoria's surgery waitlist grows, so do concerns over a 'hidden' queue

image.altText: A close-up of Donald Trump wearing a white shirt, blue suit jacket and yellow tie

props.synopsis: The US president has issued an unusually critical assessment of Vladimir Putin, saying he was angered when the Russian president criticised Volodymyr Zelenskyy's leadership.

title.children: Trump says he's 'pissed off' with Putin, threatens oil tariffs on Russia

image.altText: Malaike Mfalme and Max Pick stand beside each other with an arm around each other, smiling.

props.synopsis: Australian researchers have developed a world-first scale to measure an almost universal experience for trans adolescents and adults – gender euphoria – that could have significant implications for mental health.

title.children: Researchers take a more positive approach to trans identity
